intro: Acanthus ilicifolius var. xiamenensis, commonly known as the Xiamen acanthus, is a rare variant of the acanthus plant native to southern China. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of soft, fuzzy hair. The plant produces spiny, egg-shaped fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically along rocky stream banks or in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
distribution_native_art_desc: Acanthus ilicifolius var. xiamenensis is primarily native to southern China, particularly the coastal regions of Fujian Province. The plant is often associated with maritime environments and is sometimes found in tidal zones. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in this region.
